reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't have been happier with our stay at the Soria Moria. The staff was more welcoming and friendly than anywhere else I've stayed EVER. They always greeted us by name, asked us how our day was, how we slept, how our meal was. They were also extremely helpful when it came to planning our daily treks—there's so much to do in Siem Reap that it can be overwhelming to decide where to start. The whole property was also extremely clean, which is particularly impressive given how dusty the roads are!
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.text: There are definitely places you can stay in Siem Reap that would be more luxurious or a bit closer to the 'action' of the Pub Street area, but this hotel was perfect for a trip where you don't plan to spend much time in the room. (And why would you, given the location?) A great value, a short walk from dozens of excellent restaurants. Perfect, perfect, perfect.
reviews.title: Superb Experience

reviews.text: I can only echo the superlatives expressed by many others who've stayed at the Soria Moria. My family and I stayed for three nights and were extremely satisfied by the condition of the rooms, the location, the onsite restaurant and the staff. No doubt, there more luxurious properties in Siem Reap but for travelers seeking tremendous value, I believe the Soria Moria would more than hold its own. We arrived by bus from Phnom Penh and were met by a driver dispatched from the hotel. A 10 minute ride through town and down Wat Bo Road left me wondering whether I had made a good choice. The instant I stepped into the lobby, I had no doubt. I was struck by the tasteful, Scandinavian simplicity of the lobby and restaurant; a few minutes later, the quality and cleanliness of the rooms (208 and 209) sealed it. (208 and 209) do not have much in the way of views; we saved our "viewing" for the temples and town and only used the rooms to get undisturbed sleep. The hotel staff, from the cleaning ladies to the managers, are simply superb. I think some were trainees but it was a tremendous pleasure to offer some "assistance", however meager, toward their progress in English and "customer relations". It's a great place to stay - the onsite restaurant, offering a mix of local and western fare is very good. I would return to the Soria Moria in a heartbeat and would strongly recommend it to anyone who places a premium on good value while at the same time supporting, in small ways, the effort to help local men and women to acquire marketable skills.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Originally Scandinavian run, now co-owned by local staff who were extremely friendly and helpful. They support the local community with training programmes for street kids. Rooms were spacious and clean, and the hotel was well located for tourist nightlife and restaurants. Food was good for Cambodia - great tapas meatballs! Rooftop bar for sunset was pleasant and good little plunge pool for cooling off. Good value too. We did have a massage here - consistent with our other experiences in SE Asia, we felt a little bit beaten up by the end...
reviews.title: Friendly service, good location and responsible tourism

reviews.text: After spending three nights at the Soria Moria I have to admit that I am impressed with the service quality, fusion food (Swedish meatballs after 10 days of Asian cuisine was surprisingly tasty), stabile WIFI (although Cambodia slow) and nice rooms.

description: Soria Moria is a small cheerful hotel in the center of Siem Reap, with 38 bright and spacious rooms, establish by a Norwegian couple. Being a small intimate hotel, the Soria Moria Team is able to provide its guests with personalized service. It’s a 15 minute drive to Angkor Wat, and walking distance to the old market & the hustle and bustle of town. The hotel as an international restaurant and a Rooftop bar with great views, and there is also an open-sky Jacuzzi and a sundeck available. The initial idea behind Soria Moria was to combine a business opportunity with a strong focus on helping the community in which we work through various means. Through Soria Moria Educational Development Program the local employees have recently become majority owners of the business – an initiative to empower locals.
